Policy: Order No. 157 of the Committee on Environmental Protection under the Government of the Republic of Tajikistan validating the Criteria for classification of hazardous waste by hazardousness classes in relation to the environment.
Policy_Content: The criteria for classifying hazardous waste as a hazard class for the environment are intended for individual entrepreneurs and legal entities, in the process of the operation of which hazardous waste for the environment is generated and who are required to confirm the classification of this waste as a specific hazard class for the environment. The hazard class of waste is established according to the degree of possible harmful impact on the environment under the direct or indirect impact of hazardous waste on it in accordance with the Criteria indicated in Appendix 1, Table 1. The classification of waste as a hazard to the environment can be carried out by calculation or experimental methods. If waste generators classify waste by the calculation method as hazard class 5, it must be confirmed by the experimental method. In the absence of confirmation of the 5th hazard class by the experimental method, the waste can be attributed to the 4th hazard class. Classification of waste by the class of hazard for the environment by the calculation method is carried out on the basis of the indicator (K), which characterizes the degree of hazard of the waste when it is exposed to the environment, calculated by the sum of the hazard indicators of substances constituting the waste for the environment (Ki). The list of waste components and their quantitative content are established according to the composition of the feedstock and technological processes of its processing or according to the results of quantitative chemical analysis. The experimental method is used in the following cases: (a) to confirm the classification of waste as the 5th hazard class, established by the calculation method; (b) when attributing to the hazard class of wastes, for which it is impossible to determine their qualitative and quantitative composition; and (c) when specifying, at the request and at the expense of the interested party, the waste hazard class obtained in accordance with the calculation method.
Subject: Environment gen., Waste & hazardous substances

Policy: Nature Conservation Act (2015).
Policy_Content: This Act provides an integrated and simplified legal framework for the conservation of biological diversity and the sustainable use of its components and for the implementation of the Council Directive on the conservation of natural habitats and wild flora and fauna and the Directive of the European Parliament and the Council  on the conservation of wild birds, and various conventions on biological diversity and the protection of endangered animal and plant species and their natural living environment. The Act is divided into 12 Chapters: General Provisions (1); Natura-2000 Areas (2); Species (3); Forest resources, Timber and Timber Products (4); Exemptions, Decisions and Obligations (6); Financial Provisions (6); Enforcement (7); Miscellaneous Provisions (8);  Transitional Provisions (9); Amendment of other legislation (10); Concurrence With Other Bills (11); Final Provisions (12). Most provisions of the Act also apply to the Dutch EEZ but not to matters covered by the common European fisheries policy.

Policy: Ley Orgánica de Incentivos para Asociaciones Público-Privadas y la Inversión Extranjera.
Policy_Content: La Ley Orgánica de Incentivos para Asociaciones Público-Privadas y la Inversión Extranjera, tiene por objeto establecer incentivos para la ejecución de proyectos bajo la modalidad de asociación público-privada y los lineamientos e institucionalidad para su aplicación. Asimismo, la presente Ley establece incentivos específicos para promover en general el financiamiento productivo, la inversión nacional y la inversión extranjera. Se aplica a las asociaciones público-privadas que tienen por objeto la provisión de bienes, obras o servicios por parte del gobierno central y los gobiernos autónomos descentralizados. Los proyectos públicos aprobados se beneficiarán de los incentivos de conformidad con los acuerdos establecidos por las partes.  Estos proyectos deberán procurar la utilización del componente nacional, transferencia de tecnología y la contratación de talento humano nacional. La rentabilidad del proyecto público deberá ser calculada de manera agregada contemplando incluso la posibilidad de que excepcionalmente existan subvenciones del Estado, garantice la cobertura y la inclusión social de la población vulnerable.

Policy: Presidential Ordinance No. 001/OP on Royalty Rate of Natural Resources.
Policy_Content: This Presidential Ordinance aims to set out royalty rates of natural resources in order to ensure that the collection the royalty of natural resources is in an accurate, uniform and effective manner nationwide with the aim to create income to the government’s budget and contribute to strengthening the national socio-economic development. Article 2 establishes that: the royalty of natural resources is a financial commitment that has to be paid by domestic and foreign individual and legal entities who are authorised to exploit natural resources. The principles to set these royalty rate are as follows: 1. Based on the fundamental growth levels of production, economy and the economic and finance policies of the government; 2. Ensure sustainable development, effective utilization of natural resources and sustainable conservation; 3. Set out as the common royalty rates throughout the country. This Ordinance applies to domestic and foreign individuals and legal entities who are exploiting mining, non-timber products and water resource in Lao PDR. It does not cover plants, non-timber products that are planted by enterprises or households. Section II specifies Royalty Rates of Natural Resources, such as: Mineral Resources; Natural Resources for NTFPs; Natural water resources for hydro power plant projects, etc.

Policy: Decree No. 61.711 re-organizing the State Council for Family Farming Development (CEDAF/SP).
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 12 articles, re-organizes the State Council for Family Farming Development (CEDAF/SP). CEDAF/SP, established by Decree No. 53.623 of 30 October 2008, is reorganized under the terms of this Decree. The CEDAF/SP aims to propose guidelines for the formulation of public policies, constituting a space of articulation between different levels of government and civil society organizations, coordinating, evaluating, analyzing, and executing actions. It also aims at conducting follow-up at the state level for any actions related to sustainable rural development, implementation of family farming and agrarian reform programmes. The CEDAF/SP is responsible for: articulate, propose, and analyze the adequacy of public policies at federal, state and municipal levels, in relation to family farming, reordering the agrarian development and agrarian reform with the objective of promoting sustainable rural development in the State; monitor, analyze, evaluate and participate in the deliberative process of guidelines and procedures of public policies related to sustainable rural development and the execution of programs to support family agriculture; propose public policies aimed at harmonizing efforts and actions to stimulate the development of family agribusiness; stimulate the expansion and improvement of mechanisms of social participation and control, aiming at strengthening the sustainable rural development of family agriculture and agrarian reform, etc.

Policy: Isiolo County Wards Development Fund Act, 2015  (No. 12 of 2015).
Policy_Content: This Act provides for the establishment of the Wards Development Fund and entities at Ward level for the financing and implementation of development projects in Isiolo County. The object and purpose of this Act is to provide for a legal framework for establishment of a Fund to promote county development at ward level in order to— (a) promote economic growth and development in the county; (b) promote equity and equality in access to development services; (c) ensure rural and regional development within the county; (c) improve the standards of living among the residents of Isiolo; (e) promote interests of marginalized communities; and (d) enhance provision and access to basic services such as health, education, transport and communication and water. Wards Development Fund Committees shall be established in each Ward and shall be responsible for the preparation and implementation of projects at ward level. Projects that can be approved must be public or community-based. The Act also provides for dispute resolution and establishes a Wards Projects Forum.

Policy: National Disaster Risk Management Commission Establishment Council of Ministers Regulation No. 363/2015.
Policy_Content: This Proclamation establishes the National Disaster Risk Management Commission as an autonomous Federal Government office and defines its functions and powers. It shall be the main federal agency for disaster prevention and response coordination. In general, the Commission shall conduct appropriate activities for the comprehensive implementation and realization of the objectives of the National Disaster Risk Management Policy and Strategy and coordinate, monitor, and provide appropriate support with respect to activities carried out by the lead sector institution (i.e. the Federal or Regional Government office designated as lead sector institutions in the National Policy and Strategy on Disaster and Risk Management). The Commission shall also, among other things: Ensure that disaster risk management is mainstreamed into Government development policies, strategies, development plans and programs, and in the plans of the private sector as well as in the school curricula; collect and compile nationwide action plans for the implementation of disaster risk management policy and strategy; lead and coordinate the Federal Early Warning and Emergency Coordination Centre; coordinate, follow up and evaluate disaster risk reduction, disaster response and rehabilitation programs; implement, lead, and coordinate responses in the event of disasters that either do not fall under the responsibility of any one of designated lead sector institution; hold and administer disaster response funds and stocks. There shall be a Disaster Risk Management Council and a Commissioner. The Council shall provide general direction regarding the implementation of the National Disaster Risk Management Policy and Strategy. The Commission may import procured or donated emergency food and non-food items and equipment for disaster response purpose.

Policy: Order No. V-1441 of the Minister of Public Health validating Lithuanian hygiene standard HN 60: 2004 “Maximum permissible limits values of hazardous chemical substances in soil.”
Policy_Content: This Hygiene standard lays down limit values for dangerous substances in soil, which do not directly or indirectly (through plants, air or water) harms public health and result dangerous of the future generations. It applies to the soil of areas (plots of land) in the areas destined for building of residential facilities, scientific infrastructure (excluding institutes and scientific research facilities, observatories, meteorological stations and laboratories), healthcare facilities, hotels, recreational structures, and sports engineering structures - playgrounds and stadiums used for outdoor sports and physical education. It shall be mandatory for everyone in the Republic of Lithuania or another European Union nationals of a Member State or of the European Economic Area, for other natural persons who use the legal acts of the Republic of Lithuania or the European Union for their purposes, whose activities are directly or indirectly related to soil, possibly contaminated by economic activities, and persons monitoring soil, research institutions which, in accordance with their competences, carry out soil and public health control. Soil is a potentially fertile upper loose layer of the earth's crust when exposed to processes of soil formation from soil-forming rock (complex action of water, air, living organisms). Hazardous substance limit value – concentration of hazardous substances in soil which, depending on the purpose of the area used, to the best of its knowledge, does not endanger irreversibly the environment and human beings. Basic determination of soil contamination with hazardous chemicals the indicator is the limit value (RV) of the substance in soil.

Policy: Ministerial Decision No.67/2015 amending some provisions of the Ozone Layer Protection Regulations No.107/2013.
Policy_Content: This Resolution consisting of 3 articles aims at amending some provisions, as follows (i) art.2 states that all existing enterprises, whose production depends on the use of ozone-depleting substances must obtain permission for climate concerns. It also prohibits to grant permits to establish new or to expand existing facilities based on the use of ozone depleting substances; (ii) art.3 prohibits import, export or re-export of ozone-depleting substances without  registration with the competent authority and obtaining the ozone layer protection license; (iii) art.15 provides for submit a request to the competent authority to transfer ozone depleting substances, together with a copy of the listed documents; (iv) art.19 establishes that facilities for the maintenance, repair and servicing of air-conditioning and cooling systems containing ozone-depleting substances shall apply best practices, including the provision of gas recovery and reuse devices and control of emissions of ozone-depleting substances; (v) art.24 establishes that destruction or disposal of ozone-depleting substances is prohibited without prior approval by the competent authority; (vi) art.26 provides rules for those working with ozone depleting substances.

Policy: Order No. 1559 on cultivation of genetically modified crops.
Policy_Content: Cultivation of genetically modified crops may only be carried out by individuals authorized by the Danish AgriFish Agency. The requirement for approval for cultivation applies to owners and users of land where genetically modified crops are grown. The Agency shall approve, upon application, a course provider to issue proof of participation in training courses on the cultivation of genetically modified crops. The programme must meet requirements on the enclosed Appendix 1, and can be considered for approval of gmo crop growers. Transport of genetically modified crops must take place in accordance with the conditions set out in Appendix 2 of point C for crops.

Policy: Order No. 1549 on seeds.
Policy_Content: This Order regulates rules on grains and seeds, which may only be sold for sowing purposes, and therefore applies to any commercial activity thereof (sale, distribution, delivery etc.). This Order does not apply to the supply of grain for official control, testing and examinations – nor to the supply of grain from processing or packaging. Businesses in Denmark producing seeds for sale, must be registered with the Danish AgriFish Agency. Breeding of seeds should be based on a written contract between grower and a registered company. For the production of seed, it is mandatory that it is approved for certification complying with requirements and standards. Policy: Deeds Registries Act, 2015 (No. 14 of 2015).
Policy_Content: This Act makes provision for the registration of deeds relating to immovable property and the appointment of the Registrar of Deeds. It also provides rules for the alienation of land by the State, the manner of transfer of land in general and concerns rights in immovable property and related to leases. If the State alienates State land not previously registered in the name of any other person, then the State may transfer the ownership in the land to the transferee by means of a deed of grant issued in terms of proper authority. The owner of the subdivided land must lodge a copy of the general plan with the registrar where the land is subdivided into erven or portions shown on a general plan. If - (a) any land is expropriated under the authority of any law by; or (b) the ownership of any land has by statute been vested in, the State, a regional authority, local authority, body corporate or association of persons, the transferee must lodge as near as practicable in the prescribed form a deed of transfer with the registrar.

Policy: National Biodiversity Strategy and Action Plan 2016-2020.
Policy_Content: The National Biodiversity Strategy and Action Plan is an instrument with a multi-sectoral approach whose long-term vision is a Nigeria with healthy living environment where people live in harmony with nature and sustain the gains and benefits of biodiversity, integrating biodiversity into national programme aimed at reducing poverty and developing a secure future in line with the principle of ecological sustainability and social equity. The document is based upon Nigeria’s commitment to the Convention of Biological diversity (CBD) and aims to achieve these 5 Main Goals: 1) Address the underlying causes of biodiversity loss by mainstreaming biodiversity into national planning and societal values; 2) Reduce the direct pressures on Nigeria’s biodiversity resources and promote sustainable use; 3) Improve the status of biodiversity by safeguarding ecosystems, species and genetic diversity; 4) Ensure fair and equitable sharing of the benefits from biodiversity and ecosystem services to all; 5) Promote participatory planning, knowledge management and capacity building as an integral part of implementation of biodiversity management. The National Biodiversity Strategy and Action Plan consists of the following Chapters: 1) Introduction; 2) Status of biodiversity in Nigeria; 3) Strategy principles, priorities and targets; 4) National actions to achieve the strategy; 5) Implementation Plan; 6) Institutional Monitoring and Reporting

Policy: Regulation of the Municipal Solid Waste Management System.
Policy_Content: This Regulation consisting of 32 articles divided in XII Chapters aims to establish the procedures, conditions, and standards necessary to carry out the duties and responsibilities of the Ministry of Municipal and Rural Affairs and Municipalities in the management of municipal solid waste, the implementation of their projects, and the organization of activities and studies related to this issue in order to protect the urban environment and achieve the principles of sustainable development in the Kingdom's cities. It to all processes related to the management and projects of municipal solid waste, such as collection, separation, sorting, transport, treatment, minimization, reuse and safe disposal. Chapter II deals with tasks and responsibilities of (i) the Ministry; and (ii) Secretariats and Municipalities in order to raise the level of health and environment, and the safety and welfare of the population, and the achievement of global aspects. An emergency plan to deal with municipal solid waste in cases of necessity or exceptional circumstances will be implemented (art.12). Chapter III deals with license to practice municipal solid waste management activities, including licensing areas,   guidelines for obtaining a license, and licensing models. Chapters IV and V provide for conditions and standards of contracting. Chapter VI regards rules for selection and establishment of landfills. Chapter VII provides for rules for establishing waste sorting, treatment and recycling facilities. Chapter VIII deals with responsibilities of producers and transporters of waste. Chapter IX regards the management of buildings and demolition waste. Chapter X states that all types of municipal solid waste shall be the property of the Ministry, Secretariats and Municipalities as long as they are placed in the designated containers or in a location that is known to be a waste disposal site. Chapter XI deals with punishments for violations.

Policy: Protection of Investment (2015).
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to (a) protect investment in accordance with and subject to the Constitution, in a manner which balances the public interest and the rights and obligations of investors; (b) affirm the Republic’s sovereign right to regulate investments in the public interest; and (c) confirm the Bill of Rights in the Constitution and the laws that apply to all investors and their investments in the Republic. The text is divided into sixteen thematic Sections as follows: 1. Definitions; 2. Investment; 3. Interpretation of Act; 4. Purpose of Act; 5. Application of Act; 6. Fair administrative treatment; 7. Establishment; 8. National treatment; 9. Physical security of property; 10. Legal protection of investment; 11. Transfer of funds; 12. Right to regulate; 13. Dispute resolution; 14. Regulations; 15. Transitional arrangements; 16. Short title and commencement. This Act applies to all investments in the Republic which are made in accordance with the requirements set out in section 2. All investments must be established in compliance with the laws of the Republic (this Act does not create a right for a foreign investor or prospective foreign investor to establish an investment in the Republic). Foreign investors and their investments must not be treated less favorably than South African investors in like circumstances. Investments in terms of this Act may also be a rights or concessions conferred by law or under contract, including licenses to cultivate, extract or exploit natural resources.

Policy: Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) - Action Agenda.
Policy_Content: The Sustainable Energy for All Initiative (SE4ALL), launched by UN in 2011, has been embraced by Tanzania considering the access to modern energy services as a necessary precondition for achieving development goals beyond the energy sector, such as poverty eradication, access to clean water, improved public health and education, women’s empowerment and increase food production. The three inter-related goals, with the quantitative objectives set by Tanzania, to be achieved by 2030 are (i) ensuring universal access to modern energy services (in terms of 1.percentage of population with electricity access and 2.percentage of population with access to modern cooking solutions); (ii) doubling the rate of improvement in energy efficiency (rate of improvement in energy intensity -2.6% per year); (iii) doubling the share of renewable energy in the global energy mix. The Action Agenda (AA) includes the following priority actions (i) access Acceleration Strategy to bring energy solutions to communities and development centers that may not be reached by grid expansion; (ii) improving the structure of the energy sector; (iii) improving the policy and regulation of the energy sector; (iv) human and institutional capacity development. The SE4ALL proposition is that in order to achieve the initiative’s objectives all stakeholders need to play a leadership role as follows (i) national Government must design and implement a set of integrated country actions (i.e. country action plans); (ii) the private sector provides business and technical solutions and drives investment; and (iii) the civil society organizations advocate and monitor public policy and businesses action. The document includes an Investment Prospectuses (IP) that provides an approach to operationalizing the Country Action Agenda by identifying a set of implementable programs and projects, including their investment requirements.

Policy_Content: Este documento, aprobado por el Consejo Nacional de Áreas Protegidas (CONAP) de acuerdo con el artículo 22 del Reglamento de la Ley de áreas protegidas, contiene el Tomo IV de la actualización del Plan Maestro de la Reserva de la Biosfera Maya (RBM). El presente Tomo IV toma en cuenta todos los factores de análisis identificados en el Tomo III respecto de la Zona de Amortiguamiento de la Reserva de la Biósfera Maya (ZAM), y elabora una división administrativa interna, consistente en 5 áreas, la que se espera que permita gestionarla de manera más efectiva, así como facilitar la aplicación de la normatividad generada por tipo de actividad. Policy: National Energy Policy, 2015 (NEP, 2015).
Policy_Content: This National Energy Policy is a nationwide sectoral document aiming at (i) guiding sustainable development and utilization of energy resources to ensure optimal benefits to Tanzanians and contribute towards the transformation of the national economy; (ii) enhancing the provision of adequate, reliable, and affordable modern energy services to Tanzanians; (iii) providing comprehensive legal, regulatory, and institutional frameworks for petroleum, electricity, renewable energies, energy efficiency to achieve the Vision of a vibrant Energy Sector that contributes significantly to economic growth and improved quality of life of Tanzanians. The policy focuses on the following specific areas (i) electricity generation, transmission, distribution, interconnection, power trading, and rural electrification; (ii) petroleum and gas upstream, midstream, and downstream activities; (iii) renewable energy, energy conservation, and energy efficiency including Feed-in-tariff; and (iv) cross-cutting issues including subsidies, institutional, legal, regulatory as well as monitoring and evaluation frameworks. The Policy includes some cross-cutting issues, such as (i) ensure transparency and accountability in the development of the sector; (ii) optimize benefits accruing from Tanzania’s participation in regional and international energy projects; (iii) mainstream gender and HIV and AIDS issues in the Energy Sector.

Policy: Decreto por el que se expide la Ley de Transición Energética.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley regula el aprovechamiento sustentable de la energía así como las obligaciones en materia de energías limpias y de reducción de emisiones contaminantes de la industria eléctrica, manteniendo la competitividad de los sectores productivos. Entre los objetivos específicos de estas disposiciones se contempla: prever el incremento gradual de la participación de las energías limpias en la industria eléctrica con el objetivo de cumplir las metas establecidas en materia de generación de energías limpias y de reducción de emisiones; incorporar las externalidades en la evaluación de los costos asociados a la operación y expansión de la industria eléctrica, incluidos aquellos sobre la salud y el medio ambiente; reducir, bajo condiciones de viabilidad económica, la generación de emisiones contaminantes en la generación de energía eléctrica; apoyar el objetivo de la Ley General de Cambio Climático, relacionado con las metas de reducción de emisiones de gases y compuestos de efecto invernadero y de generación de electricidad provenientes de fuentes de energía limpia; promover el aprovechamiento energético de recursos renovables y de los residuos.

Policy: Order No. 1542 on prevention of air pollution from ships and platforms.
Policy_Content: This Order applies to Danish ships in Danish and international waters, foreign ships in Danish territorial waters, platforms in Danish territorial waters and the exclusive economic zone, as well as ports specified under article 7. The Order sets regulations regarding the ban of emissions of ozone-depleting substances from ships or platforms including discharge that occurs as part of maintaining, repairing or disposing of systems or equipment. Burning on board of normal operational waste on ships and platforms within Danish territorial waters is only allowed in a licensed incinerator. The Order implements the International Convention for the Prevention of Pollution from Ships (MARPOL).

Policy: Climate Action and Low Carbon Development Act 2015 (No. 46 of 2015).
Policy_Content: This Act provide for the approval of plans by the Government in relation to climate change for the purpose of pursuing the transition to a low carbon, climate resilient and environmentally sustainable economy by the year 2050. It sets out the commitment of Ireland to existing or future obligations under European Union law and under any relevant international agreement. EU law here includes Directive 2003/87/EC relating to the EU’s Emissions Trading Scheme and Decision No. 406/2009/EC, which sets greenhouse gas mitigation targets for the period from 2013 to 2020. Plans (a National Low Carbon Transition and Mitigation Plan and a National Climate Change Adaptation Framework) shall be made by the Minister for the Environment, Community and Local Government and submitted to the Government for approval. Sectoral  adaptation plans shall be developed. The Act sets out content and procedures of plans and establishes a National Expert Advisory Council on Climate Change to advise and make recommendations to the Minister. The Act also provides for monitoring of progress on the implementation of obligations and reporting.

Policy: Law No. 889-VIII “On public service.”
Policy_Content: This Law defines the principles, legal and organizational principles of ensuring public, professional, politically impartial, effective, focused on citizens civil service, which functions in the interests of the state and society, as well as the procedure for exercising the right of equal access of citizens of Ukraine to civil service based on their personal qualities and achievements. It establishes that civil servant must comply with the provisions of acting legislation in the field of countering corruption. Evaluation of the results of official activities shall be performed on the basis of indicators of effectiveness, efficiency and quality, determined with the consideration of job responsibilities of a civil servant, as well as compliance with the rules of ethical conduct and legal requirements in the field of anti-corruption. Grounds for termination of civil service in connection with the loss of the right to civil service or its limitation shall be entry into force of a court decision to bring civil servant to administrative liability for corruption or corruption-related offence.

Policy: Governor’s Decree No. 206-ug validating the Regulation on protection zone of nature monument of regional significance “Water storage reservoir in Gridinsky forest district”.
Policy_Content: The scope of creation of protection zone of nature monument of regional significance “Water storage reservoir in Gridinsky forest district” shall be prevention of adverse anthropogenic effects thereon. Economic and other activities causing damages to natural complexes and wild fauna and wild flora species shall be prohibited, in particular: (a) performance of works that violate the hydrogeological regime of the water storage reservoir, lead to the emergence and development of soil erosion processes; (b) soil pollution, littering of the territory, organization of landfills (including snow dumps) and dumping of domestic and non-domestic waste; (c) placement of high hazard risk industrial enterprises in accordance with sanitary classification; (d) placement of cemeteries, cattle burial grounds; (e) exploration and mining; (f) washing of vehicles; and (g) disturbance of habitats of rare and endangered plant species, mushrooms and wild fauna species recorded in the federal and in the regional Red Books. The following activities shall be authorized: (a) forest management in accordance with acting federal legislation; (b) recreation of the population, walks; (c) collection of plants and mushrooms, except for protected, endangered and rare species recorded in federal and regional Red Books; (d) hunting in accordance with hunting permits; (e) recreational physical education; (f) organization of camps and tourist stations; (g) conducting study tours, classes, seminars; and (h) authorized uses of urban land.

Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba los Lineamientos para la Formulación de Declaraciones de Manejo (DEMA) para el Aprovechamiento de Productos Forestales Diferentes a la madera, que se aplican a operaciones que se realizan en áreas pequeñas o con bajas intensidades de aprovechamiento de productos maderables y productos diferentes de la madera, que no generan impactos ambientales significativos. El Reglamento considera a la DEMA como un plan de manejo y lo define como el instrumento de planificación simplificada de corto o mediano plazo, aplicable para bajas intensidades de aprovechamiento con prácticas que no afectan de manera significativa la capacidad de recuperación del ecosistema o la especie bajo manejo.

Policy: Resolución Nº 047-2015-OEFA ─ Modifica el Reglamento del Registro de Buenas Prácticas Ambientales y el Reglamento del Régimen de Incentivos del Organismo de Evaluación y Fiscalización Ambiental (OEFA).
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución modifica el Reglamento del Registro de Buenas Prácticas Ambientales y el  Reglamento del Régimen de Incentivos del Organismo de Evaluación y Fiscalización Ambiental (OEFA). Respecto al Reglamento del Registro de Buenas Prácticas Ambientales se precisan los requisitos que deben cumplir los administrados para lograr su inscripción en el registro, a fin de garantizar que se encuentren inscritos solo aquellos que cumplen integralmente sus obligaciones ambientales fiscalizables según las supervisiones regulares realizadas por el OEFA. Respecto al Reglamento del Régimen de Incentivos se precisa aspectos del incentivo económico relacionados a su transferencia, uso y valor, con el objeto de incentivar la inversión empresarial en la realización de nuevas prácticas ambientales y garantizar un uso adecuado del incentivo otorgado.

Policy: Social Welfare Act (2015)
Policy_Content: This Act provides the organisational, economic and legal bases for social welfare, and regulates the relations relating to social welfare.  Upon the provision of social welfare assistance: (1) the needs of the person shall be taken into consideration first; (2) such measures shall be preferred which are aimed at finding possibilities and increasing the ability of the person to organise his or her life as independently as possible; (3) the person shall be advised about choosing and adjusting measures and, if necessary, about assistance provided by a specialist with appropriate professional training; (4) the efficiency of implementation of measures from the viewpoint of the person in need of assistance and, if necessary, from the viewpoint of the family and community shall be taken as the basis; (5) the person in need of assistance and, if necessary, his or her family members shall be involved in all the phases of the provision of assistance if the person has consented thereto; and (6) measures shall be ensured to be as accessible to a person as possible.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, General

Policy: Definition of Powers and Duties of Executive Organs of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia Proclamation No 916/2015.
Policy_Content: This Proclamation redefines the organization, powers and duties of the executive organs of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia. It stipulates that the powers and duties of the Prime Minister and the Council of Ministers shall be as specified in the Constitution and provides with respect to the composition and procedure of the Council of Ministers. The Proclamation also establishes various ministries and defines duties and powers of those ministries, including the Ministry of Agriculture and Natural Resources, the Ministry of Livestock and Fisheries, Ministry of Water, Irrigation and Electricity, the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change and the Ministry of Health . Furthermore it specifies executive organs that shall be accountable to the various ministries and empowers the Council of Ministers to reorganize the federal government executive organs.

Policy: Law No. 3.686 creating the Environmental Licensing System of the State of Rondônia.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 12 Chapters and 35 Annexes, creates the Environmental Licensing System of the State of Rondônia. It establishes that activities using environmental resources, considered actually or potentially polluting and causing environmental degradation are subject to different kind of environmental licensing. The Environmental Agency may issue the Environmental Licence to small-scale enterprises and activities considered low pollution potential, that meet the criteria laid down by regulation, whether set out in Annex I of this Act. The projects and activities subject to environmental licensing are listed in Annex I of this Act, without prejudice to other required by law or regulation. Environmental licensing applies to: execution of emergency works due to disaster; suppression of native vegetation; intervention in Permanent Preservation Area; selective logging; controlled fires; wildlife management, including the survey, collection, harvest, capture and monitoring; research and scientific collecting of flora within state conservation units; collectin eggs and larvae destined to breeding and scientific research; exposure and transport of products and by-products of wildlife in captivity; sustainable forest management plan of exploitation for commercial purposes; chemical weeding use, etc.

Policy: Greenhouse Gas Emission Administrative Penalties and Appeals Regulation (B.C. Reg. 248/2015).
Policy_Content: The present Regulation is made under the Greenhouse Gas Industrial Reporting and Control Act. The Regulation provides for the process for when, how much, and under what conditions administrative penalties may be levied for non-compliance with the Act or Regulations. The Regulation establishes a maximum monetary administrative penalty of $50,000 for failure to submit required reports or verification statements, or for failure to produce information or records for inspection. In addition, regulated entities may be required to retire compliance units in certain circumstances for non-compliance with the Act or Regulations; the formulas for calculating such administrative penalties are set out in the Regulation. Also, the Regulation provides that certain decisions relating to methodologies, validation and verification bodies, acceptance of project plans, and the issuance of offset units may be appealed to the Environmental Appeal Board in accordance with the procedures set out in the Environmental Management Act. The text consists of 12 sections divided into 2 Parts as follows: Administrative penalties (1); Appeals (2).

Policy: Law No. 867-VIII amending some legislative acts related to deregulation in the agro-industrial complex.
Policy_Content: Amendments to Subsoil Code (No.132/94-VR of 1994) establishes the right of landowners and land tenants to extract without any special authorization nor permit common widespread minerals and peat from subsoil to the depth of two meters, and groundwater for individual personal consumption to the amount of 300 cubic meters per day. Amendments to the Law No. 86/95-BP on pesticides and agrochemicals prohibit import to the customs territory of Ukraine, manufacturing, trade, management and advertising of pesticides and agrochemicals prior to their state legislation. Amendment to the Law No.486-IV of 2003 on fish, aquatic biodiversity and fish products establishes mandatory requirements for manufacturers of fish products to introduce at their manufacturing facilities efficient HACCP system. Amendment to the Law No. 3348-XII on plant quarantine establishes that import of biological control organisms for scientific research or biological control purposes and pests for scientific research purposes shall be authorized in accordance with the modalities set forth by the Cabinet of Ministers. Amendment to the Law No. 2498-XII on veterinary medicine establishes that the issuance of appropriate veterinary documents for feedstuffs  for the purpose of state veterinary and sanitary control shall be performed in the following cases: (a) at the request of the person who transports commodities subject to veterinary and sanitary inspection; (b) if the relevant veterinary document is required by the international trade agreement (contract); and (c) if the relevant veterinary document is required by the legislation of the importing state or by the competent authorities of the importing state. Amendment to the Law No.771/97-VR of 1997 on quality and safety of food products and food raw materials establishes that circulation of unprocessed pork food products for human consumption without appropriate veterinary documents in case of outbreaks of diseases dangerous to human and animal health shall be prohibited by decision of the central executive body in the field of food safety.

Policy_Content: The Order establishes regulations of review and documentation for the removal and transfer of land in adherence with municipal rules on notification of waste. Policy: Law No.49 of 2015 - Confirm ownership of the agricultural lands and orchards excluded from the adjustment acts.
Policy_Content: This Law consisting of 5 articles aims at regulating the ownership of agricultural lands and orchards excluded from the previous settlement acts or still not settled within and out the boundaries of the Municipality of Baghdad. Policy: Regulation on Establishment of the Advanced Industries and Knowledge-Based Enterprises
Policy_Content: The Regulation, which consists of 9 articles, determines the conditions and criteria necessary to establish the advanced industries and knowledge-based enterprises in the country.  The Ministry of Industry, Mine and Trade in collaboration with the Ministry of Agriculture are authorities responsible to enact regulations to issue establishment permits and operation license for following industries; Biotechnology (food, livestock, agriculture, industrial environment, molecular biotechnology); Nanotechnology (products and materials); Optic and Photonic; Electronics, control and hardware; Information technology, communication and software; Advanced manufacturing and laboratory equipment; Leading medications; Medical equipment; Aerospace (aircrafts, missiles, satellites); New energies(renewable energies); leading products in fields of cognitive science, herbal medicines, agriculture, oil, gas, petrochemicals, water, soil, mine, marine innovations, buildings and road construction. The advanced industrial units should be located outside the urban and rural area, within the industrial parks or science and technology parks. Ministry of Industry, Mine and Trade may determine the water use limit for each advanced industry which requires water in its production process.
Subject: Energy

Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba los Lineamientos para autorizar el establecimiento de centros de propagación de especies ornamentales de flora silvestre. La Autoridad Regional Forestal y de Fauna Silvestre (ARFFS) entrega autorizaciones a los centros de propagación para la colecta de especies ornamentales, y para su incorporación en el Registro Nacional de Centros de Propagación. Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba los Lineamientos para la Inscripción de las Plantaciones en el Registro Nacional de Plantaciones Forestales, con la finalidad de: 1) sistematizar la información que se obtenga sobre la existencia y condiciones de las plantaciones forestales a nivel nacional, lo cual permitirá elaborar estadísticas públicas y adoptar decisiones oportunas; 2) garantizar los derechos de las personas naturales o jurídicas sobre el recurso plantado, las mismas que a partir de ello, podrán tramitar su inscripción registral ante la Superintendencia Nacional de los Registros Públicos (SUNARP), constituir hipotecas u otros derechos reales de garantía; 3) generar condiciones atractivas para el desarrollo de una industria forestal basada en el establecimiento de plantaciones forestales competitivas que abastezcan al mercado interno y externo de productos forestales maderables y no maderables; 4) facilitar las acciones de administración y control que realiza el Estado, sobre los recursos forestales.

Policy: Resolución Nº 164-2015-SERFOR ─ Lineamientos para la elaboración de Declaraciones de Manejo en contratos de cesión en uso para bosques residuales o remanentes.
Policy_Content: La presente Resolución aprueba los Lineamientos para la elaboración de Declaraciones de Manejo (DEMA) en contratos de cesión en uso para bosques residuales o remanentes y el formato respectivo. La DEMA, que el Reglamento considera como un plan de manejo, lo define como el instrumento de planificación simplificada de corto o mediano plazo, aplicable para bajas intensidades de aprovechamiento con prácticas que no afectan de manera significativa la capacidad de recuperación del ecosistema o la especie bajo manejo. Se considera bosque residual o remanente a los bosques naturales primarios aislados, producto de la fragmentación del hábitat por procesos de ocupación y transformación de paisajes anteriormente forestales, que pueden ser destinados a funciones de protección o aprovechamiento de productos no maderables.

Policy: Decree No. 52.751 creating the Water and Soil Conservation Policy.
Policy_Content: This Decree creates the Water and Soil Conservation Policy in the state of Rio Grande do Sul, coordinated by the Secretariat of Agriculture, Livestock and Irrigation, in order to stimulate and promote actions aimed at soil and water conservation. This Policy aims to improve the productive, social and environmental relations. Its objectives are: increase the permeation capacity of agricultural land; reduce water erosion rate; decrease the risk of water scarcity from the preservation of water in the soil; develop a technical assistance project and Rural and Social Extension - ATERS, regarding the use and soil and water conservation; promote integrated actions between the State Public Administration, through the Secretariat of Agriculture, Livestock and Irrigation, the Secretariat of Environment and Sustainable Development, Rural Development and Cooperatives Secretariat and the Department of Education; and perform actions in partnership with public and private agencies and entities such as the Riograndense Association of Technical Assistance Projects and Rural Extension and Credit Sulina Association and Rural Assistance (EMATER-NASCAR/RS), the State Agricultural Research of Rio Grande Foundation South - FEPAGRO, the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock and Supply (MAPA), the Ministry of Agrarian Development (MDA), the Brazilian Agricultural Research Corporation (EMBRAPA), the Federation of Associations of Rio Grande do Sul Municipalities (FAMURS) and other institutions, agencies and public and private entities.

Policy: Regional Law No. 565-PK “On protected areas”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law classifies regional protected areas as follows: (a) natural parks; (b) state nature reserves; (c) nature monuments; (d) dendrological parks and botanical gardens; (e) protected landscapes; (f) protected nurseries; and (g) historical and natural complexes and areas. Cultural memorial parks and ecological parks can also be set up on the regional territory. The presence and location of protected areas shall be taken into consideration in the process of elaboration of land-use planning schemes. Owners of land plots located within the boundaries of protected areas must comply with protection regime applicable thereto. State supervision over protected areas of regional significance shall be performed by the authorized state regional institution in the sphere of environmental protection and ecological supervision.

Policy: Law No. 4351 on Grazing Land in Greece and other provisions.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes rights to graze land in Greece, including public forests, forestry lands and grasslands referred to in article 3 of Law No. 998/1979 (A'289). It establishes that grazing rights on authorized grazing lands according to approved grazing management plans shall be allocated by the relevant Regional Units to farmers. To this end, a Committee for the distribution of Grazing Rights within the Regional Unity concerned shall be set up, the members of which shall be appointed by decision of the Regional Governor. Farmers who use private grazing land, owned or rented by individuals or Private law legal entities (NPIDs), are allocated extra land only for the portion of livestock not covered by the private lands. The rights to use the grazing shall be granted to farmers for a period corresponding to the achievement of the grazing management plans, which may not be less than 3 years, by signing a relevant leasing contract. If grazing lands are forbidden to be grazed or land identified as forestable areas, in the context of forestry legislation, the aforementioned Regional Unity Committee shall make appropriate grazing rights accordingly.

Policy: Tonga’s Intended Nationally Determined Contributions.
Policy_Content: Tonga’s Intended Nationally Determined Contributions is a national policy developed with a multi-sectoral approach to achieve the objective of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change. Tonga’s intended contributions at the national level are (I) 50% of electricity generation from renewable sources by 2020; (II) 70% of electricity generation from renewable sources by 2030; (III) doubling the 2015 number of marine protected areas by 2030; (IV) sector emission reduction targets; and (V) climate resilience in other sectors.

Policy: Machakos County Government Administrative Structures Act, 2015 (No. 10 of 2015).
Policy_Content: This Act provides with respect to the public administration and public participation in Machakos County. The object of this Act is to— (a) give effect to Part VI of the County Governments Act; (b) provide for the establishment of county administrative structure; (c) co-ordinate service delivery by the county government; (d) provide for powers, functions, and responsibilities of administrative officers; (e) coordinate the provision of county government services in all parts of the county; and (f) provide mechanisms for cooperation between the county government and national government. The county shall be divided into (a) sub counties; (b) wards; and (c) villages. Each shall be administered by an administrator. For every village there shall be a village council established in accordance with section 53 of the County Governments Act. An administrative officer may issue orders for various purposes including protection of the environment and water resources and (animal) disease control.

Policy: Machakos County E-Waste Management Act, 2015 (No. 4 of 2015).
Policy_Content: This Act concerns e-waste", i.e. discarded electrical and electronic equipment which is capable of being hazardous to the environment. The object and purpose of this Act is to— (a) establish the institutional framework necessary for purposes of ensuring an efficient e-waste management in the county; (b) promote an environmentally friendly county that reduces health risks associated with e-waste; (c) encourage citizens to take responsibility for their environment; (d) to put in place a mechanism of effective public awareness on issues related to e-waste and its management; (e) to create an enabling environment for promotion of public and private investments in e-waste management; and (f) to establish appropriate strategies for End of Life (EOL) management of electrical and electronic equipment. The Act declares that every person within the county is entitled to a clean and healthy which free from e-waste and has a duty to safeguard and enhance the quality of the environment and to ensure safe disposal of e-waste . The county government shall put in place measures to ensure save dumping of e-waste and shall designate dump site and land fields for e-waste. A County E-waste Management Committee is established.

Policy: Order No. 1417 on user fees for approval and supervision by the Danish Environmental Protection Act.
Policy_Content: This Order sets guidelines on the protection of the environment by whomever is responsible for public or private facility or arrangement of livestock and metal production. Those shall be responsible for seeking authorization of activities, installations and design thereof in accordance to the Environmental Protection Act. Specifically the declaration in connection with  approval of activities by polluting businesses; the approval on the protection of surface water in connection with its pollution; the treatment of processors of articles made of iron, steel or other metals; the supervision of compliance by the local councils; and the supervision and approval of animal keeping.

Policy: Décret exécutif n° 15-303 du 20 Safar 1437 correspondant au 2 décembre 2015 portant organisation de l’administration centrale du ministère de l’énergie.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe l’organisation de l’administration centrale du ministère de l’énergie.  Sous la tutelle du ministre de l’énergie, l’administration centrale du ministère de l’énergie comprend: le secrétaire général, assisté de deux (2) directeurs d’études; le chef de cabinet, assisté de huit (8) chargés d’études et de synthèse; l’inspection générale dont l’organisation, le fonctionnement et les missions sont fixées par décret exécutif; et les structures suivantes (la direction générale des hydrocarbures; la direction générale de l’électricité, du gaz et des énergies nouvelles et renouvelables; la direction générale des études et de la prospective; la direction générale de l’administration et des finances; la direction de la réglementation et des études juridiques; la direction de la protection du patrimoine; et la direction de la coopération internationale.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Africa, Mediterranean, NEAR EAST AND NORTH AFRICA, Northern Africa

Policy: Décret exécutif n° 15-302 du 20 Safar 1437 correspondant au 2 décembre 2015 fixant les attributions du ministre de l’énergie.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret fixe les attributions du ministre de l’énergie. En effet, dans le cadre de la politique générale du Gouvernement, le ministre de l’énergie est chargé de l’élaboration des politiques et stratégies de recherche, de production et de valorisation des ressources d’hydrocarbures et énergétiques et du développement des industries s’y rapportant. Il en assure la mise en œuvre conformément aux lois et règlements en vigueur. A ce titre, il propose, en conformité avec le programme du Gouvernement, les éléments de définition de la politique énergétique. Il rend compte des résultats de ses activités au Premier ministre et au conseil des ministres, selon les formes, les modalités et les échéances établies.
Subject: Energy

Policy: Regulation No. 970 date 2.12.2015 concerning the licensing requirements and procedures for the trading of oil and its by-products.
Policy_Content: This Regulation lays down requirements and rules of procedure regarding the licensing of operators involved in the trading of oil and its by-products. The wholesale trading of oil and its by-products is conducted exclusively by companies established as Ltds and supplied with trading licenses by the National Center of Licensing. The Regulation consists of five parts: Licensing procedures for the wholesale trading of oil and its by-products (I); Licensing procedures for the retail of fuels, gas, and auto lubricant oils to the end consumer (II); Requirements for wholesale trading of oil and its by-products (III); Compliance with Technical Requirements (IV); and Final Provisions (V).

Policy: Decreto Nº 39.483/MAG - Crea el Foro Nacional Mixto y de los Foros Regionales Mixtos de organizaciones de pequeños y medianos productores y del sector público agropecuario.
Policy_Content: El presente Decreto crea el Creación del Foro Nacional Mixto y de los Foros Regionales Mixtos de organizaciones de pequeños y medianos productores y del sector público agropecuario. Dentro de los fines propuestos del Foro Nacional Mixto están: 1) Facilitar el acercamiento entre las instituciones del sector público agropecuario y las organizaciones de productores y constituirse en una instancia nacional de trabajo, diálogo y concertación para informar, analizar y proponer acciones para el desarrollo del sector; 2) Analizar y proponer soluciones mediante el establecimiento de una agenda nacional, los temas que afectan el desarrollo agro productivo y la calidad de vida de los pequeños y medianos productores y productoras; 3) Facilitar el intercambio de experiencias entre cada uno de los miembros del Foro Nacional y otros sectores que intervengan o sean coparticipes en el desarrollo del sector; 4) Plantear e impulsar programas y proyectos de inversión que mejoren el desempeño de las economías rurales en los territorios; 5) Emitir criterio y recomendaciones acerca de temas vinculados al sector agropecuario ante el poder ejecutivo y legislativo cuando así se requiera.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development

Policy: Order No. 460 of the Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources validating the Regulation on the procedure for distribution of estimated consumption of ozone depleting substances.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes the procedure for the distribution of the estimated volume of consumption of ozone-depleting substances for the import or export of ozone-depleting substances and the commodities containing them. The total amount of ozone-depleting substances, the shares of which are distributed among business entities, may not exceed the estimated amount of ozone-depleting substances established for Ukraine in accordance with the requirements of the Montreal Protocol and the decisions of the Meeting of the Parties to the Montreal Protocol for the relevant period and the definite form of their consumption. The Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources of Ukraine at the beginning of the reporting period distributes the shares of the estimated volume of consumption of ozone-depleting substances between business entities that intend to import ozone-depleting substances or products containing them for a given calendar year. The decision on the distribution of the estimated volume of consumption of ozone-depleting substances between economic entities is made by the commission, the composition of which is approved by the Ministry of Ecology and Natural Resources of Ukraine.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: Black Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Loi n° 2015-58 du 02 décembre 2015 portant création, missions, organisation et fonctionnement d'une Autorité Administrative Indépendante dénommée: Autorité de Régulation du Secteur de l'Energie « ARSE ».
Policy_Content: La loi crée une l’Autorité de Régulation du Secteur de l'Energie (ARSE) et fixe missions, son organisation et son fonctionnement. Toutefois, les activités pétrolières du segment Amont à savoir la recherche, l'exploration, l'exploitation et la production des hydrocarbures sont exclues du champ d'application de la présente loi. L’Autorité de Régulation du Secteur de l'Energie « ARSE » assure une mission de service public de régulation des activités exercées dans les sous-secteurs de l’Electricité et des Hydrocarbures-Segment A val sur le territoire du Niger, conformément aux lois et règlements en vigueur. A ce titre, elle est chargée de: veiller à l’application des textes législatifs et règlementaires régissant les sous-secteurs de L’Electricité et des Hydrocarbures-Segment Aval dans des conditions objectives, transparentes et non discriminatoires; protéger les intérêts des utilisateurs et des opérateurs, en prenant toute mesure propre à garantir, dans le cadre des dispositions légales et réglementaires en vigueur, l'exercice d'une concurrence saine et loyale dans les sous-secteurs régulés; promouvoir le développement efficace des sous-secteurs en veillant, notamment, à l'équilibre économique et financier et a la préservation des conditions économiques nécessaires à leur viabilité ; exercer les pouvoirs de contrôle et de sanctions, soit d'office, soit à la demande de toute personne physique ou morale ayant intérêt à agir; contrôler le respect par les opérateurs des prescriptions résultant des dispositions législatives et réglementaires qui leur sont applicables ainsi que des engagements afférents aux conventions, contrats, licences et autorisations dont ils bénéficient et ce, à travers, un cahier des charges prédéfini; constater les manquements à la règlementation, mettre en demeure les auteurs d'y remédier et saisir les juridictions compétentes; mettre en œuvre les mécanismes de consultation des utilisateurs et des opérateurs prévus par les lois et règlements ; évaluer la satisfaction de la clientèle; effectuer toute mission d'intérêt public qui pourrait lui être confiée par l'Etat dans les sous-secteurs de l’électricité et des hydrocarbures; notifier et publier au bulletin officiel de l'Autorité de Régulation du Secteur de l'Energie «ARSE» toute décision prise à l'encontre d'un contrevenant et notifiée a lui dans les délais impartis.
Subject: Energy
Geographical_area: Africa, Sahel, Western Africa

Policy: Storage of Carbon Dioxide (Licensing etc.) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015 (S.R. No. 387 of 2015).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement Article 2 (in part) and Articles 3 to 17 and 19 of Directive 2009/31/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the geological storage of carbon dioxide concerning: (1) the granting of permits for the operation of carbon dioxide storage sites (and related exploration activities); (2) the obligations of the storage operator (for example in relation to monitoring, reporting and corrective measures) whilst storage activities are taking place; (3) the operator’s continuing obligations for a period after the closure of the storage site; and (4) the inspection of carbon dioxide storage complexes. The Regulations prevent the licensing of carbon dioxide storage in the water column, as defined by the Directive ("the vertically continuous mass of water from the surface to the bottom sediments of a water body"). Operators shall have environmental liability under  Directive 2004/35/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of on environmental liability with regard to the prevention and remedying of environmental damage.

Policy: Storage of Carbon Dioxide (Access to Infrastructure) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015 (S.R. No. 388 of 2015).
Policy_Content: These Regulations implement in Northern Ireland Articles 21 and 22 of Directive 2009/31/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on the geological storage of carbon dioxide. Those articles provide with respect to third party access to carbon dioxide storage sites and transport networks. These Regulations provide with respect to storage permits and stipulate, among other things, that, where a person has previously sought to secure access to a relevant pipe-line or storage site by application to the owner, but has not been able to reach agreement with the owner, the person may apply to the Department of Enterprise, Trade and Investment for a notice granting that access.

Policy: Law No. 4.266 establishing the State Policy of the Amazon Environmental Services, their Management System, and creating the State Fund for Climate Change, Environmental Conservation and Environmental Services.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 3 Chapters divided into 38 articles, establishes the State Policy of the Amazon Environmental Services, their Management System, and creates the State Fund for Climate Change, Environmental Conservation and Environmental Services. It also amends provisions of the State Law No. 3.135/2007 and 3.184/2007. The State Policy objectives are: protecting and conserving natural environment providing the environmental services while promoting socio-economic development and welfare of local populations; reducing illegal logging of forests in the state of Amazonas and consequently reducing the emission of greenhouse gases maintaining the forest carbon stocks; creating and strengthening governance structures that allow mutual recognition at the national and international level of the programmes and projects to encourage the maintenance and provision of environmental services; promoting the creation of management tools, which enable the execution of programmes and projects for the maintenance and provision of environmental services; establishing through legal instruments that facilitate the action of potential developers and investors, as well as ensure the fair distribution of benefits to recipients providers of goods and environmental services; establish infrastructure and adoption of systems and measuring instruments, collection, analysis, measurement, validation, monitoring, verification and valuation of environmental goods and services; contribute to ensuring the territorial and cultural rights of Indigenous and Traditional Peoples Communities and their sustainable development.

Policy: Forests (Export of Timber) Regulations, 2015 (S.I. No.94 of 2015).
Policy_Content: These Regulations place restrictions on the exportation of timber and timber products from Zambia. They also specify species of timber that may not be used to manufacture railway sleepers. Specified timber and timber may be exported by holders of a concession licence or a timber merchants with a permit to be issued by the Director of Forestry. The Director shall, where the applicant meets the requirements of the Act, issue a permit in Form III set out in the Schedule. He or she shall reject an application for a permit if— (a) the applicant fails to meet the requirements of the Act; (b) the permit issued to the applicant was cancelled by the Director; or (c) the applicant is convicted of an offence under the Act or any other written law. The Department shall keep and maintain a register of permits in Form VIII set out in the Schedule. The Regulations also concern suspension or cancellation of a permit, restriction on quantities of timber to be exported, and inspection and clearance before export and other export procedures.

Policy: Order No. 1375 on special contributions to particularly polluted wastewater.
Policy_Content: The Order sets out rules for the calculation of pollution contents in particularly polluted wastewaters, the cost of special polluted wastewater and inventory, collection and documentation of special contributions and wastewater companies, as well as their administration. A wastewater utility company must set limit values for particularly polluted wastewater and for all its parameters in costs for special measures, except for organic matter that has been determined as COD (Chemical Oxygen Demand), total nitrogen and total phosphorus. Calculation of special contributions for 2015 shall apply to current rules. In particular, polluted wastewater defined in this Order shall include COD, total nitrogen and total phosphorus wastewater containing: a) more than 1 600 mg/l of organic matter that has been determined as COD; b) more than 100 mg/l total nitrogen; or  c) more than 15 mg/l total phosphorus.

Policy: Regional Law No. 117-ZKO “On delimitation of plenary powers between state bodies in the sphere of land relations”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Law delimits plenary powers between regional state bodies. Regional Administration shall have the following competence: (a) decision-making related to cadastre land valuation and setting cadastre value of land; (b) decision-making related to transfer of land from one category to another; (c) decision-making related to land expropriation; and (c) application or removal of public land servitude. Policy: Regional Decree No. 457 validating the Regulation on regional state nature reserve “Kokorevsky”.
Policy_Content: Regional state nature reserve “Kokorevsky” shall be classified as complex reserve constituted without land expropriation. It shall perform the following functions: (a) protection of Kokorevo wetlands with rare and endangered wild flora species typical of aapa bogs; (b) protection of wetlands with nesting grounds of rare sandpiper (Actitis hypoleucos) and other rare bird species; (c) protection of habitats and and migratory routes of migratory bird species; (d) protection of natural habitats of European beaver; and (e) protection of rare and endangered biodiversity. The following activities shall be prohibited: (a) all types of felling, timber extraction and collection of non-timber products; (b) application of toxic chemicals; (c) introduction of alien species; (d) explosive works; (e) exploration and mining; and (f) passage and parking of motor vehicles.

Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée au Burkina Faso l’Agence Nationale d’Encadrement des Exploitations Minières Artisanales et Semi-mécanisées (ANEEMAS) dont les missions sont: encadrement technique des activités d’exploitation artisanale de l’or; le suivi-contrôle des circuits de commercialisation; la régulation de la commercialisation par l’achat sur tous les sites; le suivi administratif et règlementaire en vue de réduire la part d’informel et la responsabilisation des orpailleurs; l’aménagement d’infrastructures; la surveillance environnementale; la restauration des sites dégradés. L’objet de ANEEMAS est l’encadrement et la surveillance des activités d’exploitations artisanale et semi-mécanisée de l’or dans le but de: contribuer à minimiser les impacts négatifs de l’exploitation artisanale sur l’environnement ; contribuer à assurer une meilleure sécurité sur les sites; contribuer à réduire la fraude dans la commercialisation de l’or produit artisanalement ; contribuer à éradiquer le travail des enfants sur les sites d’exploitation artisanale. Les statuts de l’Agence Nationale d’Encadrement des Exploitations Minières Artisanales et Semi-mécanisées sont approuvés par décret pris en Conseil des Ministres sur rapport du Ministre chargé des Mines.

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 724 validating Programs of the development of the pasture of the Republic of Tajikistan for 2016 – 2020.
Policy_Content: This Governmental Decree states that national pastures are the main source of feed for cattle, livestock and horses, and provide more than 60-70 percent of their annual needs. Improving the condition of pastures has special importance in ensuring the country's food security and reducing the poverty level of the population. In order to develop stockbreeding sector a solid and reliable fodder supply shall be ensured. The scope of the Program shall be improvement of quality, yield and rational management of pastures. The Program aims to increase pasture reserves with natural vegetation using modern technology by sowing seeds of natural vegetation of pastures and increasing their productivity up to 15 - 20 quintals. This Program is designed for increase of livestock, production of meat, milk, leather and wool in all types of business entities for the purpose of provision of the population with food, and provision of industry with raw materials, creation of new jobs and improving the living standards of rural population. The final goal shall be increasing profits of all types of business entities and thus ensuring economic growth of the country.

Policy: Law No. 423-V ZRK “On production of organic goods”.
Policy_Content: This Law defines legal, economic, social and organizational basis for the production of organic goods aimed at securing rational use of soil, facilitation and creation of healthy nutrition and environmental protection. This Law governs the relations arising between the organic goods producers and other natural and physical bodies, designated agencies in the field of production of organic goods. The principles of producing organic goods are the following: (a) facilitation in securing healthy nutrition; (b) limiting the use of non-renewable natural resources; (c) provision of environmental safety and preservation of environmental systems; and (d) preservation and reproduction of soil fertility. Producers of organic goods and persons who perform the turnover of such goods are liable to secure safety in production of organic goods and to meet the requirements of the legislation of the Republic of Kazakhstan in the area of production of organic goods. When producing organic goods the following conditions shall be met: (a) use of healthy livestock and plants, safe produce and raw livestock and plant material;(b) to exclude the application of synthetic substances, pesticides (chemicals), hormones, antibiotics and food supplements, except when it is envisaged by the rules of production and turnover of organic goods; (c) to exclude the use of genetically modified organisms;(d) to exclude application of methods of crop production goods without the use of soil; (e) to exclude the use of ionizing radiation;(f) preservation and reproduction of soil fertility; (g) minimizing the use of non-renewable natural resources; and (i) to exclude chemical methods of treating wild plants.

Policy: Resolution CONAMA No. 472 providing for the use of chemical dispersants in oil pollution incidents at sea.
Policy_Content: This Resolution, consisting of 18 articles and four Annexes, regulates the use of chemical dispersants in oil pollution incidents at sea. IBAMA will establish, through Norm, the procedures and requirements necessary to obtain the registration of the chemical dispersants. The application of these dispersants to respond to oil pollution incidents at sea must be previously communicated to IBAMA. The Communication on the Use of Chemical Dispersant to IBAMA shall be forwarded according to the form in Annex I. If the oil slick may, according to the available evidence, impact a Coastal State of the Federation, it is necessary to forward at the same time the communication to the state environmental agency. The application of chemical dispersants as a technique for responding to oil pollution incidents can only be used when non-intervention or application of mechanical containment, scattering and dispersion techniques are not effective, inapplicable or insufficient. These provisions do not apply when emergency measures are required for situations of imminent risk of fire or the safeguarding of human life at sea involving marine installations or ships.

Policy: Complementary Law No. 842 creating the State Fund to Fight and Eradicate Poverty (FECOEP/RO).
Policy_Content: This Complementary Law, consisting of 9 articles, creates the State Fund to Fight and Eradicate Poverty (FECOEP/RO), linked to the State Secretariat for Social Assistance and Development (SEAS), aimed at enabling the population of the State of Rondônia, access to decent levels of subsistence, through supplementary actions of nutrition, education, health, basic sanitation and other programmes of relevant social interest, aimed at improving the quality of life, as provided for in Article 82 of the Transitional Constitutional Provisions Act (ADCT) of the Federal Constitution. FECOEP/RO resources should be applied in the following activities: a) food and nutritional security, through the acquisition of basic food baskets and support to productive chains such as beekeeping, fruit growing, goat and sheep breeding, dairy farming, agroindustry, floriculture, coffee cultivation, poultry breeding and fish farming; b) educational security, through literacy programmes; c) programmes of health care and protection; and d) actions, projects or programmes to combat poverty defined in the State's Multi-Year Plan.

Policy: Order No. 1318 on commercial keeping of livestock, manure, silage.
Policy_Content: The Order sets regulations on manure use with the purpose of establishing standard animal keeping compounds and storage of such biomass. In Chapter 2 it sets regulations on the establishment of facilities, as well as extensions and modifications thereof for animal husbandry; these shall not be authorized if causing pollution. Stables and similar enclosures for animals shall be designed so that contamination of groundwater and surface water does not occur. They must have floors constructed of durable materials which are impermeable to moisture. An appropriate drainage system shall be mandatory for collecting liquid manure and waste water (Chapter 3).  For livestock farms storing manure or plant biomass, requirement for storage facilities must have a certain capacity to meet the requirements set by Order on agricultural use of fertilizers and plant cover. Storage facilities must at least have a capacity equivalent to 6 months' supply (Chapter 4). There is an authorized allowance of maximum spread of manure volume of plant biomass corresponding to 1.4 of livestock units/ha on a yearly basis and plan period from 1 August to 31 July (Chapter 11). All information must be notified and registered with the local municipalities - under the regulation of the Ministry of Environment.

Policy: Décret nº 2015-086 PR du 26-11-2015 portant création, organisation et fonctionnement du programme d'appui aux populations vulnérables (PAPV).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret crée un programme spécial d’urgence visant à favoriser une croissance économique Populations Vulnérables (PAPV). Le PAPV a pour mission d'assurer la coordination des actions visant la réalisation et/ou la réhabilitation rapide des infrastructures de base ainsi que des projets socioéconomiques au profit des populations, notamment les couches les plus vulnérables. Il couvre les domaines suivants : l’eau, l’électricité ; la santé ; l’éducation ; l’habitat ; la salubrité et l’assainissement ; les infrastructures de bas; la finance inclusive ; l’emploi des jeunes. Le PAPV comprend un Conseil d'Orientation Stratégique (COS) et une Cellule d'Administration et de Gestion (CAG).

Policy: Local Government (Wales) Act 2015 (2015 anaw 6).
Policy_Content: The Act concerns local government in Wales. It mainly concerns reform (merger) of local authorities in Wales and amends existing legislative provision in the Local Government (Wales) Measure 2011 and the Local Government (Democracy) (Wales) Act 2013. This Act makes provision for, and in connection with, the merger of two or more existing principal areas into a single new principal area, with a new principal local authority. The Welsh Ministers may direct that— (a) a merging authority must not carry out a restricted activity unless it has considered the opinion of a specified person or persons on the appropriateness of carrying out the activity; (b) a merging authority must not carry out a restricted activity unless the written consent of a specified person or persons has been given for the activity to be carried out. The restricted activities include making a relevant land acquisition or disposal.
